title: World Geography: Continents and Physical Features

vocab.definition: One of the seven large landmasses on Earth
Half of the Earth, divided by the equator or prime meridian
Lines that measure distance north and south of the equator
Lines that measure distance east and west of the prime meridian
The physical features of land, including mountains, rivers, and plains

teachingNotes: Use world maps and globes extensively. Practice using latitude and longitude coordinates. Discuss how geography affects climate and culture.

sample.question: How many continents are there on Earth?

truefalse.question: The equator divides Earth into northern and southern hemispheres.

multiplechoice.question: Which lines measure distance east and west?

fillintheblank.question: The physical features of land are called ________.

shortanswer.question: Name the seven continents.
expectedAny: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, Australia
Asia, Africa, Americas, Europe, Australia, Antarctica
